channel.title: Ski Days
channel.description: This season brought the arrival of helmet-cam. This had me playing with Alli’s mac to make movies. After the season, I got my own macbook (to stop hogging her hard drive)...and so for this season’s “archive”, I’m gonna try the blog functionality in iWeb rather than putting the html together by hand (like I used to).

item.title: Closing Day
item.description: Closing day...Alli dressed up again as Jane.  Did a front-side run with her and Max, then took off to the bowl.  Got another 6" last night, but the temps stayed warm, so it was heavy powder.  Had the S7's, and they did *great* with it.  Did a bunch of Bowl laps (far side), and a bunch of laps through upper switchyard trees.  Had to head over to c-lift for the closing madness...Alli and I met up with Max over there.

item.title: Closing weekend, back in Business
item.description: Got the new phone:  an HTC thunderbolt.  (Something about working the SW on both chips...eat your own breakfast kinda thing...)  Had about 6" on the ground when I woke up.  Mom and Max were feeling mellow; did one run down cheshire, then ran off on my own.  No pioneer or eagle open...those closed down last week.   Bunch of bowl laps, including the upper switchyard stuff.  Did lower tophers, weather station, and rettas to close the day.

item.title: The Kids
item.description:
Large crew descended on Winter Park...the full Stephens’, QJ, Pei, and Sarah, and Didi, Uli, Lara, and Lucas. Did some laps under Pano...got some fun footage there. Gunter and I tried to convince Michelle to go do some bumps instead of doing lunch, but alas, to no avail.

We went and did some bump laps, but it was getting *really* warm. My waxing skills can deal with about 50F, but past that, and things get sticky. At that point, I wasn’t really having fun anymore, so I headed back to the car...and realized that I had lost my loaner cell phone! Bummer! The good news is that someone found it and turned it in, so I didn’t have to look like a major klutzoid to Greg.

item.title: Boulder Modem Ski Day
item.description:
Planning for the Modem Ski Day on Friday, showing off Phresheez to folks (to track each other)...and on wednesday, my Droid goes nuts. The touch screen takes phantom presses all over the place. The second time it happened, it decided to call Troy (whilst he was on vacation with the familiy at Disney World). Tried to power it off...but that button just turns off the screen when a call is in progress. Finally pulled the battery...he calls back because he thinks it’s an emergency. “No, just a butt-dial.” Look around, and the Thunderbolt is out...our 9k with 7x30. I know of the issues we have, and know it’s gonna suck as far as battery life, but I decide to get it anyways. Long story short (too late!) I’m without tracking for a while.

The Boulder Modem Ski day was on my bday...nice day to ditch work. Had QC pay for lift tix and lessons for those who wanted ‘em. Did some warmup runs under Pano with Chuck, Ehren, Kurt, Matt, Stan, Tom, and Praveen...then took Matt, Kurt and Ehren on some bump runs. When Matt and Kurt’s legs didn’t have any more juice, I took Ehren on Runaway and Topher’s Trees. Met up with the crew under Olympia.

Did dinner at Beau Jos....then headed back over the pass to Fraser and the rest of my weekend. Come in, start unloading, and Max says he wants to show me something. Claps his hands, and Gunter comes out from behind the couch!!! WAAAAYYY surprised! Great Bday!

item.title: Belle Laps AM, Gunter PM
item.description: Woke up to only an inch or two at the house, but WP claimed 7.  Ditched out early, got my first chair at 8:35.  Did a lap through the bowl and kinikinick, then did a bunch of Bella laps.  Snagged my jacket on a tree; had ski patrol help me patch it up with some athletic tape.  Met up with Gunter around noon...did some Eagle Wind laps, then headed down to Pioneer, and did a bunch of the tree runs in there.

item.title: Belle Laps with Gunter, then Rescuing Max
item.description: Decent snow, but max didn't wanna do the top, so he stuck with Mom as Gunter and I did some laps through Belle & Eagle Wind.  Met up with them later; Gunter and I took max (as he was driving Mom crazy!) Went all over...Max *loves* following Gunter through the trees!!!

item.title: Gunter and the Bridge
item.description:
Woke up to 5.5" on the ground...enough to cover the icy bumps.  Gunter, Max and I headed out early...did a BUNCH of trees and fresh tracks.  Tried to get over to Eagle Wind, but although they said the run was open, it was roped off (so we had to ditch into the switchyard trees).  Showed them the brakeman trees, did lower tophers, the frenchman trees, the do-or-die trees...all good!

And, the highlight: Gunter does the bridge between Cranmer and Outrigger!

item.title: Alli & Max
item.description: Alli has her new powder G3s; we do a bunch of laps through belle with Max. No vid, but we do finally get Max into the meadow. Pics below....

item.title: QC Ski Day - Keystone
item.description:
Started the day with some warmup-runs with Bhavna, Simon, Lucille, Mark, Rick, and others. Then went to the Outback, met up with PJ, and did some bumps with him and Mark and Rick. After a couple runs there, Mark and Rick split off, and PJ and I played in the Black Forest area. Pretty cool back there...similar to Eagle Wind. Met up with Bijan, and did some other laps there.

Started to get tired, met up with Bhavna and crew for some more cruiser runs (and one mini-bump run). Back to the bus, and a typical ride home.

item.title: Max Cam
item.description:
Put the helmet-cam on Max, and followed him around all day....well, at least until we ran outta gas. Two cool things about those vids:
1) You can hear what he’s saying. (no, he *never* is quiet)
2) I got some shots of me!

item.title: Alta Powder Day
item.description:
12" saturday during the day, another 12" overnight.  Alli and Max decided to hang out with Kate and the inlaws...Gunter and I headed up just as soon as they opened little cottonwood.  EVIL traffic...finally hit the slopes around noonish.
The wildcat area (right side) was epic!  Actually, the whole mountain was epic...did a bunch of runs in there, and WOW do those S7s rock!!!  We did stuff off of Collins, and then headed over to Supreme, where we ended up doing some *super* steep stuff.  My favorite:  looking at a rope suspended in air over a cliffy/chute area, we joked "hey, that does no good"...but realized that it was a warning to not "huck the cliff".  We tool around, look up, and there is that rope right above us!

item.title: Alta with the Inlaws
item.description: Cold, snowy, but loads of fresh. A good day with Alli, Max, Kate, Kaleb, and Pam.

item.title: Lighter Day With Max and Gunter
item.description: Gunter came out for Boys weekend (Alli doing rugby). Max was “iffy” today...but we convinced him to to a half day. Met up with Matthias, put the camera on Max and let him cruise around...that definitely lifted his spirits.

item.title: Show ‘n Tell: Tophers
item.description:
Alli had rugby this weekend, so, to continue the tradition, Gunter came out for “boys weekend”. Max had class, so I had to do some show ‘n tell, and show Gunter the Skis and the plaque for Tophers.

This is a legendary underground area at Jane. The story goes that Topher hit a tree well and died, and to mark it, they put his skis on the tree where he bit it. There’s also a plaque you can see from Corona way if you look hard.

No vids from the day, but here are a couple pics...

item.title: Pass Closed!
item.description:
9" fresh snow, and Berthoud Pass closed!!!

Pano opened around noon...tree trails weren't steep enough...had to point tips straight down.  Belle was *epic"....had to do 2 laps through there.

item.title: Max Race + Exploring
item.description:
Had to try some new tree trails...did the stagecoach trees...not bad.  Also explored on the Trestle end of Tophers.  The bottom part is good...not too steep, but going in above the cliff leads to some scary stuff.  Top was closed all day.  :(

Here’s the pic of the plaque at tophers:

item.title: Meadow vid & Belle Pics
item.description:
Warm day...skiied with Alli in the morning, then ran off in the afternoon. Finally got the meadow; ran into a lost snowboarder in there. Headed over and did a lap through Belle; much more cut up than it was last week with Matthias (and they marked that rock).

Here’s a couple pics from Belle:

item.title: The Day After the Storm
item.description: Jane was crazy in the morning, as everyone was trying to get to the fresh from yesterday's dump.  Matthias and I did Belle...good snow there, but Matthias hit a rock and got a core shot (bummer!).

item.title: Snow for Mary Jane’s Birthday
item.description: Woke up to a couple inches of fresh pow, and it snowed all day.  Dropped Max off at the sharks, then Matthias and I did Outhouse as the warmup.  Good stuff!  Met up with Alli, Lucille, and Gunter over on the Jane side...Alli was skiing in her "MJ" dress (very cool!!!)  Twas windy, so Pano and Eagle Wind were closed.  They all stopped for lunch, but I skied through it...they opened the eagle wind trails (even though the lifts were closed), so I had to do a couple old-school laps through there.  AWESOME snow back there...I was second-tracks the first time through.  Awesome day!!!

item.title: Meeting up with Matthias
item.description: Met up with Matthias today...started off on Vasquez, then hit the back gate to eagle wind (left hand still had good snow!). One run down the bowl; went a little too aggressive and launched into a tree. Good bruise from that one. Then headed over to the the c-lift and hit some bumps before the knees went out. :)

item.title: The Chairlift Challenge
item.description: Today’s challenge: ride every chairlift on the mountain. (But only the ones you sit on...no surface lifts.) Makes for a cool phreshez map. :)

item.title: Old-School Backside Parsenn
item.description:
Some fresh (3" overnight, snowing all day), so I brought out the s7s.  I *LOVE* those skis!!!.  Eagle Wind wasn't running, but the trails were open, so I did the old-school 3-lifts-to-backside-parsenn.  GREAT snow back there, and no people!!!  And, found another hut down near black coal.
Bella was also open (but not advertised...), so I *had* to go do that.  Decent coverage, but there were a few rocks under all that Pow.

item.title: Skiing with Max, Gunter, Alli, and the Stephens’
item.description:
Last day of xmas break. Started off the day with Max, Gunter, and Alli...hit the park. Quickly devolved to me and Max trying to find Gunter (doing drills from the lesson with Jay). That pretty much sums up the “part 1” video.

Then, Part 2. Meet Rod, Michelle, Ken, and Amy at Snoasis. Okay, maybe not meet...ambush. Do a bunch of tree runs. Fun!

item.title: Matthias on the Big Feet
item.description:
Gunter convinced Matthias to take out the Big Feet today...and to be fair, we waxed & edged ‘em so they were properly tuned. (Very important for high quality skis like that) Took him a couple runs to get used to them, but got some good footage in the meanwhile.

The day had some pretty evil wind chill...Max and I bailed after lunch.

item.title: Afternoon with Gunter
item.description: Playing around in the afternoon...do or die trees, some pioneer speed trails, couple laps through the terrain park, and ending on long-haul/short-haul.

item.title: Max Day!
item.description: Alli and Gunter had a lesson with Jay, so Max and I played around. Did some bumps, met up with Matthias and Lucille, and then joined Ray and Tressa.

item.title: Meeting up with Matthias, Ray, Tressa, Gunter and Lucille
item.description:
Woke up to 2" of fresh, so I hit the slopes early.  The Pano Trees were better than the bowl, so I did a couple runs there, then headed to eagle wind.  Stalked Matthias and Ray, saw they were at Pioneer with Tressa, so headed over there and did a couple nice runs down Gambler and Aces and Eights.  Lucille's lesson ended at noon, so we then caught up with them.  Gunter came out and did some tele-drills in preparation for his lesson...Tressa and I joined him whilst everyone else did lunch.  Had to fetch his poles from under the pony...(did he do that on purpose?)
Hit a bunch of the mountain...good day!

item.title: Cruisin’ With Gunter
item.description: After presents, Gunter and I headed over to do some “lighter” skiing. Did a bunch of the easier trees, and *had* to do some bumps. My favorite part of the day: cruising over at pioneer. Gunter was working on Tele drills, so we tried a “2-lap/3-lap” interleaving. I tried to “gain” as many chairs as I could...typically for those speed runs, it was around 30+ chairs. Looking at Phresheez, my speeds were in the 35-40 mph range. Note in the vid below, this is “real time”...no speeding up. Fun!

item.title: The Challenger Challange
item.description:
Gunter and I try and do all the black runs under the c-lift...needless to say I was *really* sore after that. He convinced me to try the chutes early in the day...I’m still not ready for that. Too narrow, too many rocks, and *way* too steep. After a couple turns, I traversed through the trees to Runaway.

The other milestone...it’s getting towards the end of the day, and Gunter convinces me to try and find Gaz’s Gate. I agree (foolishly). We do the turn-off from roundhouse, and start climbing up. There’s a fork, and since we’re both tired of skating uphill, we take the lower branch, which leads us to a cliff. Not enough room to get your skis sideways. We both end up taking our skis off and scooting down...not really much fun. With all that, I’m not agreeing to a crazy “lets do this!” until 2012!

item.title: Playing around with Alli, Max, and Gunter
item.description: Another fun day...did some laps under Eagle Wind and Pioneer, then headed over to Jane. Did a run down Runaway, where someone almost took Gunter out (nice dodging!) Played around under Pano for a while, then broke off and hit the Franken-run with Gunter.

item.title: Playing with Max
item.description: Ran around all over the place with Max...had him announce several of the runs in the vid below (cute!) This also has my favorite fall from this season (okay, my favorite fall captured on film...)

item.title: Powder Hunting with Alli, Max, and Gunter
item.description: So here I am, in mid-june 2011, going back through the old archives. I did the original movie on Alli’s mac, so I don’t have the original edits anymore. Gonna go through it again (as it probably needs a better soundtrack), but looking back, this is one of my favorite days from last season. Skiing with Alli, Max, Gunter...good attitudes, good snow, and just playing around and enjoying the day.

item.title: Max, Matthias, Lucille, and Ray
item.description:
Matthias and Lucille came up...spent the morning skiing with them (and Max).  Not as many freshies as yesterday, but still good, soft, snow. 

After lunch, Max was done.  Took him and Lucille back to the mountain house...and then met back up with Matthias and Ray, and did some more bumps.

item.title: Sniffing Powder
item.description: Good snow...little dump the night before.  Ran around with the s7s looking for good powder stashes. Decent stuff on aces and eights, primrose, and the trees above Edelweiss.

item.title: Max Cam AM, Matthias PM
item.description:
Max and I spent the morning exploring...hi-lo trees, sunnyside, dilly-dally. 

Tagged up with Matthias in the afternoon over at Vasquez...played with the "helmet cam".  Went to the terrain park, did some mini jumps, then headed back to Jane.

item.title: The Cannonball Fall
item.description: Max's first day in Park Sharks.  Alli and I skiied together in the morning, hitting the trees under hi-lo, and heading over to vasquez. Hit a bunch of bumps after that...including one *spectacular* fall on cannonball.  Unfortunately, didn’t catch it on film. Took a corner too fast, went airborn, landed, and slammed my heel on a rock. (I think it was one of the two “cannonballs” that are the namesake of the run. Got an evil bruise outta that one. That stinger stayed with me the whole season.

item.title: Morning with Max and Gunter
item.description: Started off with Alli, Max, and Gunter, but Alli's toe was bugging her, so she bailed.  Gunter and Max and I headed over to Vasquez to do some more bumps...after a couple runs, Max took a spill and was done.  Worked our way over to Jane base where we met up with Alli, then Gunter and I did two more bump runs before calling it a day.

item.title: First try: Max Cam
item.description: Day #3...Max wants to come out with Gunter and me.  Tried the trees off Stagecoach...a little too windblown.  Gambler was good though...put the helmet cam on max and had him bomb that run!  Also spent some time over at Jane...Boiler was in really good shape.

item.title: Alli, Max, and Gunter After Thanksgiving
item.description: Good "after thanksgiving" day.  Still great conditions!!!  Warm up on Trestle, did a bunch of runs on the high lonesome trees.

item.title: Thanksgiving with Gunter and Max
item.description:
A very cold day at winter park, but great snow for early season!  They had all lifts running *but* the pano, eagle, and iron horse.  Did a couple "hot chocolate" breaks with max to keep him warm.

Two movies for today...the first, Outhouse!

item.title: Opening Weekend
item.description:
Starting out the day, had a work fire explode. Did some business from the lift, but I couldn’t risk running Phresheez on the Droid and not being able to do email/phone. Note, I fixed that shortly thereafter by getting a spare battery for the Droid and keeping both charged.

Played around a little with helmet-cam. Got some good shots of Max doing Retta’s, at least until he took a major fall (way in front of me). That pretty much ended his day; I ended up playing around a little more in the trees.
